ext_descriptions.ext_description: An application_context, as defined in ISO 10303-1, is a context in which product data is defined and has meaning. An application_context represents various types of information that relate to product data and may affect the meaning and usage of that data.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the application_context is known.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
The description attribute aids in defining the usage of product data in an application_context.
This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to application_context as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.
This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to application_context as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the set of instances of the entity data type
that defines the various aspects of the application_context.

ext_description.p:
Each application_context shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.

ext_description.p:
Each application_context shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An application_context_element is an aspect of an application context that contains information about the context in which product data is defined. This aspect contains information about the conditions in which the product data exists.
An application_context_element may be either a
or a , or a , or a .

ext_description.p:
the
by which the application_context_element is known.
ext_description.example: 'Functional definition', 'physical definition', 'usage occurrence', and 'manufacturable definition' are examples of names.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
of which this application_context_element is a member.

An application_context_relationship is a relationship between two instances of
and provides a description of their relationship.
The role of application_context_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Without any further specialization, this relationship does not imply that the product data associated with relating_context are also associated with the related_context.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the application_context_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the application_context_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An application_protocol_definition is the identification of an application protocol.

ext_description.p: the label that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the application protocol.
ext_description.example: "IS", "DIS", "TS" or "CD" are examples of application protocol states.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the EXPRESS schema name of the application interpreted model.
the year when the application protocol attained the status given by the status attribute.
the application context of the application protocol.

A library_context is a type of
that defines a context for elements of a library.
The inherited attribute
identifies or characterizes the type of library.
The name attribute can represent the nature of the source of the library, the nature of the contents of the library, or both.
'Dewey Decimal', 'ISO 13584 library', and 'supplier catalogue' are examples of type of library.

ext_description.p:
If a member of
is provided, then that member shall be referenced by a member of .
ext_description.note: A library_context is an incompletely modelled entity data type.

ext_description.example: 'ACME self-propelled rocket sleds catalogue' is an example of a library reference.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_concept_context is a type of
that defines a context for a
(see ISO 10303-44).
A product_concept_context represents information that relates to the characterization of potential purchasers of a product. Such information may affect the meaning and usage of the product data.

ext_description.p:
the
that identifies the kind of consumer preferences associated with a product.
ext_description.example: 'Luxury automobiles', 'laptop personal computers', and 'budget personal stereos' are examples of market_segment_types.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_context is a type of
that represents life cycle independent information about a . This information describes the discipline in which data about the product are created.
Different annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity data type can make use of common values for the attributes of the product_context entity data type in order to establish consistency among schemas that relate to the same types or kinds of products.
Two annotated EXPRESS schemas that specify product data structures for design and construction of buildings respectively can each constrain the values of the name attribute to be 'building', and the discipline_type attribute to be 'architecture'.
The inherited attribute
identifies a particular industry, subject area, or kind of product for which product data is created or used.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
'ship', 'aircraft' and 'building' are examples of names of product contexts.

ext_description.p:
the
that identifies a particular field of practice involved in creating or using product data.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: 'electronics', 'engineering', or 'architecture' are examples of discipline types.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_definition_context is a type of
that represents information about the stage in the product life cycle for which a
is created or used.
Different annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity data type can make use of common values for the attributes of the product_definition_context entity data type in order to maintain consistency between schemas that relate to the same or related life-cycle phases.
Two annotated EXPRESS schemas that specify product data structures for conceptual design and detailed design of process plants respectively can each constrain the values of the name attribute to be 'conceptual design' and 'detailed design', and the life_cycle_stage attribute to be 'design'.
The inherited attribute
identifies a subdivision or characterization of a life cycle stage for which product data is created or used.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
'required' and 'planned' are examples of names of product definition contexts, used in conjunction with a life cycle stage of 'thermal analysis'.

ext_description.p:
the
that identifies a stage in the life cycle of a product.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: A 'preliminary design' and 'manufacturing planning' are examples of life cycle stages.
